meanings.definition: To make impure again by contact or mixture
meanings.sent1: Leaving the food uncovered can recontaminate it with germs.
meanings.sent2: The spilled chemicals recontaminate the water source.
meanings.sent3: Oops! I accidentally recontaminated the clean water with dirty hands.
meanings.sent4: The careless actions recontaminate the once pristine environment.
meanings.sent5: The act of touching the wound with unwashed hands recontaminates it, leading to infection.

meanings.definition: To pollute again by exposure to harmful substances
meanings.sent1: The factory's waste recontaminates the river with toxins.
meanings.sent2: After the cleanup, any new spill will recontaminate the area.
meanings.sent3: The rain unexpectedly recontaminated the freshly washed car with mud.
meanings.sent4: The smoke from the fire recontaminates the air we breathe.
meanings.sent5: The leak in the pipe recontaminates the soil with oil, harming the plants.

meanings.definition: To infect again with harmful microorganisms
meanings.sent1: Not washing your hands can recontaminate the wound and cause infection.
meanings.sent2: The unsterilized equipment recontaminates the surgical site.
meanings.sent3: The sneeze accidentally recontaminated the room with germs.
meanings.sent4: The lack of hygiene practices recontaminates the food, leading to illness.
meanings.sent5: The dirty utensils recontaminate the dishes, spreading harmful bacteria.
